Other Typealiases.html#/s:10SyncServer14.name: TappableButton
Other Typealiases.html#/s:10SyncServer14.abstract: A UIView is used to enable a broader description– we’re really thinking UIControl or UIButton.

Classes/FacebookSyncServerSignIn.html#/s.name: credentials
Classes/FacebookSyncServerSignIn.html#/s.abstract: Returns non-nil if the user is signed in, and credentials could be refreshed during this app launch.

Classes/DropboxSyncServerSignIn.html#/s:.name: setupSignInButton(params:)
Classes/DropboxSyncServerSignIn.html#/s:.abstract: The parameter must be given with key viewController and value, a UIViewController conforming object.

Classes/DropboxCredentials.html#/s:10Syn.name: userId
Classes/DropboxCredentials.html#/s:10Syn.abstract: A unique identifier for the user. E.g., for Google this is their sub.

Classes/DropboxCredentials.html#/s:10Syn.name: username
Classes/DropboxCredentials.html#/s:10Syn.abstract: This is sent to the server as a human-readable means to identify the user.

Classes/DropboxCredentials.html#/s:10Syn.name: uiDisplayName
Classes/DropboxCredentials.html#/s:10Syn.abstract: A name suitable for identifying the user via the UI. If available this should be the users email. Otherwise, it could be the same as the username.

Classes/FacebookCredentials.html.name: FacebookCredentials
Classes/FacebookCredentials.html.abstract: Enables you to sign in as a Facebook user to (a) create a new sharing user (must have an invitation from another SyncServer user), or (b) sign in as an existing sharing user.

Protocols/Tappable.html#/s:10SyncServer8.name: tap()
Protocols/Tappable.html#/s:10SyncServer8.abstract: The intent is that this will cause a touchUpInside action to be sent to the underlying button.

Protocols/GenericSignInDelegate.html#/s:.name: userActionOccurred(action:signIn:)
Protocols/GenericSignInDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: Before calling this delegate method, the implementing code must present any UI alerts as needed. E.g., if an owning user was successfully created, present an alert to tell the user.

Protocols/GenericSignIn.html#/s:10SyncSe.name: signInTypesAllowed
Protocols/GenericSignIn.html#/s:10SyncSe.abstract: Some services, e.g., Facebook, are only suitable for sharing users– i.e., they don’t have cloud storage.

Protocols/GenericSignIn.html#/s:10SyncSe.name: signOutDelegate
Protocols/GenericSignIn.html#/s:10SyncSe.abstract: Delegate not dependent on the UI. Typically present through lifespan of app.

Protocols/GenericSignIn.html#/s:10SyncSe.name: delegate
Protocols/GenericSignIn.html#/s:10SyncSe.abstract: Delegate dependent on the UI. Typically present through only part of lifespan of app.

Protocols/GenericSignIn.html#/s:10SyncSe.name: appLaunchSetup(userSignedIn:withLaunchOptions:)
Protocols/GenericSignIn.html#/s:10SyncSe.abstract: userSignedIn, when true, indicates that the user was signed-in with this GenericSignIn last time, and not signed out.

Protocols/GenericSignIn.html#/s:10SyncSe.name: networkChangedState(networkIsOnline:)
Protocols/GenericSignIn.html#/s:10SyncSe.abstract: To enable sticky sign-in, and the GenericSignIn to refresh credentials if that wasn’t possible at app launch, this will be called when network connectivity changes state.

Protocols/GenericSignIn.html#/s:10SyncSe.name: setupSignInButton(params:)
Protocols/GenericSignIn.html#/s:10SyncSe.abstract: The UI element to use to allow signing in. A successful result will give a non-nil UI element. Each time this method is called, the same element instance is returned. Passing nil will bypass the parameters required if any.

Protocols/GenericSignIn.html#/s:10SyncSe.name: userIsSignedIn
Protocols/GenericSignIn.html#/s:10SyncSe.abstract: Sign-in is sticky. Once signed-in, they tend to stay signed-in.

Protocols/GenericCredentials.html#/s:10S.name: userId
Protocols/GenericCredentials.html#/s:10S.abstract: A unique identifier for the user for the specific account type. E.g., for Google this is their sub.

Protocols/GenericCredentials.html#/s:10S.name: username
Protocols/GenericCredentials.html#/s:10S.abstract: This is sent to the server as a human-readable means to identify the user.

Protocols/GenericCredentials.html#/s:10S.name: uiDisplayName
Protocols/GenericCredentials.html#/s:10S.abstract: A name suitable for identifying the user via the UI. If available this should be the users email. Otherwise, it could be the same as the username.

Protocols/GenericCredentials.html#/s:10S.name: refreshCredentials(completion:)
Protocols/GenericCredentials.html#/s:10S.abstract: If your credentials scheme enables a refresh, i.e., on the credentials expiring.

Enums/SignInUIState.html#/s:10SyncServer.name: initialSignInViewShowing
Enums/SignInUIState.html#/s:10SyncServer.abstract: asking if user wants to sign-in as existing or new user

Enums/SignInUIState.html#/s:10SyncServer.name: createNewAccount
Enums/SignInUIState.html#/s:10SyncServer.abstract: view showing allows user to create a new (owning) user

Enums/SignInUIState.html#/s:10SyncServer.name: existingAccount
Enums/SignInUIState.html#/s:10SyncServer.abstract: view allowing user to sign in as existing user

Classes/SharingInvitation/Invitation.htm.name: sharingInvitationPermission
Classes/SharingInvitation/Invitation.htm.abstract: It seems odd to have this coming in as a URL parameter, but it has no effect on the permissions granted. Rather, it’s here for the UI– to tell the invited person what kind of permissions they would get if they accept the invitation. (The alternative would be to have a dedicated backend call which would return the sharing permission given the invitation code).

Classes/SharingInvitation.html#/s:10Sync.name: receive()
Classes/SharingInvitation.html#/s:10Sync.abstract: This to deal with the case where the delegate method of this class wasn’t set before the invitation was received. See https://github.com/crspybits/SharedImages/issues/42

Classes/SharingInvitation.html#/s:10Sync.name: createSharingURL(invitationCode:permission:)
Classes/SharingInvitation.html#/s:10Sync.abstract: This URL/String is suitable for sending in an email to the person being invited.

Classes/SharingInvitation.html#/s:10Sync.name: application(_:open:options:)
Classes/SharingInvitation.html#/s:10Sync.abstract: Returns true iff can handle the url.

Classes/SyncServerUser.html#/s:10SyncSer.name: syncServerUserId
Classes/SyncServerUser.html#/s:10SyncSer.abstract: A unique identifier for the user on the SyncServer system. If creds are set this will be set.

Classes/SyncServerUser.html#/s:10SyncSer.name: checkForExistingUser(creds:completion:)
Classes/SyncServerUser.html#/s:10SyncSer.abstract: Calls the server API method to check credentials.

Classes/SyncServerUser.html#/s:10SyncSer.name: addUser(creds:completion:)
Classes/SyncServerUser.html#/s:10SyncSer.abstract: Calls the server API method to add a user.

Classes/SyncServerUser.html#/s:10SyncSer.name: createSharingInvitation(withPermission:completion:)
Classes/SyncServerUser.html#/s:10SyncSer.abstract: Calls the server API method to create a sharing invitation.

Classes/SyncServerUser.html#/s:10SyncSer.name: redeemSharingInvitation(creds:invitationCode:completion:)
Classes/SyncServerUser.html#/s:10SyncSer.abstract: Calls the server API method to redeem a sharing invitation.

Classes/SignInManager.html#/s:10SyncServ.name: currentUIDisplayName
Classes/SignInManager.html#/s:10SyncServ.abstract: These must be stored in user defaults– so that if they delete the app, we lose it, and can start again. Storing both the currentUIDisplayName and userId because the userId (at least for Google) is just a number and not intelligible in the UI.

Classes/SignInManager.html#/s:10SyncServ.name: currentSignIn
Classes/SignInManager.html#/s:10SyncServ.abstract: Set this to establish the current SignIn mechanism in use in the app.

Classes/SignInManager.html#/s:10SyncServ.name: addSignIn(_:launchOptions:)
Classes/SignInManager.html#/s:10SyncServ.abstract: At launch, you must set up all the SignIn’s that you’ll be presenting to the user. This will call their appLaunchSetup method.

Classes/SignInManager.html#/s:10SyncServ.name: application(_:open:options:)
Classes/SignInManager.html#/s:10SyncServ.abstract: Based on the currently active signin method, this will call the corresponding method on that class.

Enums/ServerContentType.html#/s:10SyncSe.name: both
Enums/ServerContentType.html#/s:10SyncSe.abstract: Both a file download and an appMetaData update.

Enums/ConflictingClientOperation/Content.name: both
Enums/ConflictingClientOperation/Content.abstract: There are both appMetaData and file uploads conflicting

Enums/ConflictingClientOperation.html#/s.name: both
Enums/ConflictingClientOperation.html#/s.abstract: There are both upload deletions and content uploads conflicting.

Enums/DownloadDeletionResolution/Content.name: keepContentUpload
Enums/DownloadDeletionResolution/Content.abstract: It is an error to select this for a conflict with a purely appMetaData upload – because a pure appMetaData upload cannot undelete or restore the content of a file that has already been deleted.

Enums/DownloadDeletionResolution.html#/s.name: rejectDownloadDeletion
Enums/DownloadDeletionResolution.html#/s.abstract: For a file with a non-nil fileGroupUUID, this will also reject all pending download deletions for files with the same fileGroupUUID.

Enums/ContentDownloadResolution/UploadRe.name: keepAll
Enums/ContentDownloadResolution/UploadRe.abstract: If you are going to use rejectContentDownload (see below), this is the typical upload resolution.

Enums/ContentDownloadResolution/UploadRe.name: removeAll
Enums/ContentDownloadResolution/UploadRe.abstract: Remove any conflicting local content uploads and/or upload deletions.

Enums/ContentDownloadResolution/UploadRe.name: keepContentUploads
Enums/ContentDownloadResolution/UploadRe.abstract: Not having this option means to remove your conflicting content uploads

Enums/ContentDownloadResolution/UploadRe.name: keepUploadDeletions
Enums/ContentDownloadResolution/UploadRe.abstract: Not having this option means to remove your conflicting upload deletions.

Enums/ContentDownloadResolution.html#/s:.name: acceptContentDownload
Enums/ContentDownloadResolution.html#/s:.abstract: Deletes any conflicting content upload and/or upload deletion.

Classes/SyncServerConflict.html.name: SyncServerConflict
Classes/SyncServerConflict.html.abstract: When you receive a conflict in a callback method, you must resolve the conflict by calling resolveConflict.

Enums/ContentDownloadResolution.html.name: ContentDownloadResolution
Enums/ContentDownloadResolution.html.abstract: Content downloads can conflict with content upload(s) and/or an upload deletion. See the conflictType of the specific SyncServerConflict.

Enums/DownloadDeletionResolution.html.name: DownloadDeletionResolution
Enums/DownloadDeletionResolution.html.abstract: Download deletions can conflict with file uploads and/or appMetaData uploads. A server download deletion and a client file upload deletion don’t conflict (it’s just two people trying to delete at about the same time, which is fine).

Enums/ConflictingClientOperation.html.name: ConflictingClientOperation
Enums/ConflictingClientOperation.html.abstract: Because downloads are higher-priority (than uploads) with the SyncServer, all conflicts effectively originate from a server download operation: A download-deletion, a file-download, or an appMetaData download. The type of server operation will be apparent from the context.

Structs/ServerVersion.html#/s:10SyncServ.name: init(rawValue:)
Structs/ServerVersion.html#/s:10SyncServ.abstract: Format: X.Y.Z, where X, Y, and Z are integers.

Structs/DownloadOperation/OperationType..name: file
Structs/DownloadOperation/OperationType..abstract: May also include an appMetaData update. In the context, see the SyncAttributes.

Enums/SyncServerError.html#/s:10SyncServ.name: noCellularDataConnection
Enums/SyncServerError.html#/s:10SyncServ.abstract: If this is reported, it is diagnostic of a network error. It is not reported simply due to a check for a cellular data connection. i.e., no network was present and this may be the reason why.

Enums/SyncServerError.html#/s:10SyncServ.name: badServerVersion
Enums/SyncServerError.html#/s:10SyncServ.abstract: The minimum server version you gave in appLaunchSetup was not met. Immediately this is raised as an error, the SyncServer client stops operating.

Enums/SyncEvent.html#/s:10SyncServer0A5E.name: willStartDownloads
Enums/SyncEvent.html#/s:10SyncServer0A5E.abstract: This can repeat if there is a change to the files on the server (a master version update), and downloads restart.

Enums/SyncEvent.html#/s:10SyncServer0A5E.name: singleFileUploadComplete
Enums/SyncEvent.html#/s:10SyncServer0A5E.abstract: The attributes report the actual creation and update dates of the file– as established by the server.

Enums/SyncEvent.html#/s:10SyncServer0A5E.name: syncStopping
Enums/SyncEvent.html#/s:10SyncServer0A5E.abstract: Occurs after call to stopSync, when the synchronization is just about to stop. syncDone will be the next event (if desired).

Protocols/SyncServerDelegate.html#/s:10S.name: syncServerMustResolveContentDownloadConflict(_:downloadedContentAttributes:uploadConflict:)
Protocols/SyncServerDelegate.html#/s:10S.abstract: The client has to decide how to resolve the content-download conflicts. The resolveConflict method of the SyncServerConflict must be called. The statements below apply for the SMRelativeLocalURL’s.

Protocols/SyncServerDelegate.html#/s:10S.name: syncServerMustResolveDownloadDeletionConflicts(conflicts:)
Protocols/SyncServerDelegate.html#/s:10S.abstract: The client has to decide how to resolve the download-deletion conflicts. The resolveConflict method of each DownloadDeletionConflict.uploadConflict must be called.

Protocols/SyncServerDelegate.html#/s:10S.name: syncServerFileGroupDownloadComplete(group:)
Protocols/SyncServerDelegate.html#/s:10S.abstract: Called at the end of a group download, on non-error conditions, after resolution of conflicts.

Protocols/SyncServerDelegate.html#/s:10S.name: syncServerEventOccurred(event:)
Protocols/SyncServerDelegate.html#/s:10S.abstract: Reports events. Useful for testing and UI.

Structs/SyncAttributes.html#/s:10SyncSer.name: fileGroupUUID
Structs/SyncAttributes.html#/s:10SyncSer.abstract: Supplied by the client (and only stored by the server, not used by the server otherwise). Used to indicate that a collection of files needs to be upload and downloaded as a group. Once a particular fileUUID is associated with a fileGroupUUID, it must always be associated with that fileGroupUUID. If not provided, then the file is a group of one and that fileUUID must always be a group of one (have a nil fileGroupUUID).

Structs/SyncAttributes.html#/s:10SyncSer.name: creationDate
Structs/SyncAttributes.html#/s:10SyncSer.abstract: These dates only get used for responses from the server– because it is the authority on dates.

Classes/SyncServer/LocalConsistencyResul.name: clientMissingAndDeleted
Classes/SyncServer/LocalConsistencyResul.abstract: Files not known to the caller of this interface and known to be deleted by this SyncServer interface.

Classes/SyncServer/LocalConsistencyResul.name: clientMissingNotDeleted
Classes/SyncServer/LocalConsistencyResul.abstract: Files not known to the caller of this interface and known to be not deleted by this SyncServer interface.

Classes/SyncServer/LocalConsistencyResul.name: directoryMissing
Classes/SyncServer/LocalConsistencyResul.abstract: Files not tracked or otherwise known about by this SyncServer interface.

Classes/SyncServer/ResetType.html#/s:10S.name: tracking
Classes/SyncServer/ResetType.html#/s:10S.abstract: Resets only persistent data that tracks uploads and downloads in the SyncServer. Makes no server calls. This should not be required, but sometimes is useful due to bugs or crashes in the SyncServer and could be required.

Classes/SyncServer/ResetType.html#/s:10S.name: all
Classes/SyncServer/ResetType.html#/s:10S.abstract: A powerful operation. Permanently removes all local/cached metadata known by the client interface. E.g., metadata about files that you have previously uploaded. It makes no server calls. This is similar to deleting and re-installing the app– except that it does not delete the files referenced by the meta data. You must keep track of files and, if desired, delete them.

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: eventsDesired
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: Enable reporting of only events desired by the client app.

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: delegate
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: The delegate enables operations such as file downloads & conflict resolution.

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: appLaunchSetup(withServerURL:cloudFolderName:minimumServerVersion:)
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: Put a call to this in your AppDelegate or other place early in the launch sequence of your app.

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: application(_:handleEventsForBackgroundURLSession:completionHandler:)
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: For dealing with background uploading/downloading. Call this from the same named delegate method in your AppDelegate.

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: uploadImmutable(localFile:withAttributes:)
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: Enqueue a local immutable file for subsequent upload.

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: uploadCopy(localFile:withAttributes:)
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: A copy of the file is made, and that is used for uploading. The caller can then change their original and it doesn’t affect the upload. The copy is removed after the upload completes. This operation proceeds like uploadImmutable otherwise.

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: uploadAppMetaData(attr:)
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: Enqueue an upload of changed app meta data for an existing file.

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: delete(fileWithUUID:)
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: This method enqueues an upload deletion operation. The operation persists across app launches. It is an error to try again later to upload, or delete the file referenced by this UUID. You can only delete files that are already known to the SyncServer (e.g., that you’ve uploaded).

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: delete(filesWithUUIDs:)
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: As above, but you can give multiple UUIDs.

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: sync()
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: If no other sync is taking place, this will asynchronously do pending downloads, file uploads, and upload deletions. If there is a sync currently taking place, this closes the collection of uploads/deletions queued, and will wait until after the current sync is done, and try again.

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: stopSync()
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: Stop an ongoing sync operation. This will stop the operation at the next natural stopping point. E.g., after a next download completes. No effect if no ongoing sync operation. Any delayed sync is cancelled.

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: getAttributes(forUUID:)
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: Operates synchronously and quickly. A file must have already been uploaded (or downloaded) for you to be able to get its attributes. It is an error to call this for a uuid that doesn’t yet exist, or for one that has already been deleted.

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: getStats(completion:)
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: This information is for general purpose use (e.g., UI) and makes no guarantees about files to be downloaded when you next do a sync operation.

Classes/SyncServer/ResetType.html.name: ResetType
Classes/SyncServer/ResetType.html.abstract: The type of reset to perform with a call to reset.

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: reset(type:)
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: Does a reset of local (not server) tracking data.

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: logAllTracking(completion:)
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: Logs information about all tracking internal meta data.

Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.name: localConsistencyCheck(clientFiles:)
Classes/SyncServer.html#/s:10SyncServerA.abstract: Performs a similar operation to a file system consistency or integrity check. Only operates if not currently synchronizing. Suitable for running at app startup.

Classes/SyncServer.html.name: SyncServer
Classes/SyncServer.html.abstract: Synchronize files and app meta data with other instances of the same client sapp.

Protocols/SyncServerDelegate.html.name: SyncServerDelegate
Protocols/SyncServerDelegate.html.abstract: Except as noted, these delegate methods are called on the main thread.

Enums/SyncEvent.html.name: SyncEvent
Enums/SyncEvent.html.abstract: Most of the information provided by SyncEvent’s is for testing purposes and for UI (e.g., for displaying download progress). Some of it, however, can be necessary for app operations.

Enums/SyncServerError.html.name: SyncServerError
Enums/SyncServerError.html.abstract: Many of these only have internal meaning to the client interface. Some are documented because they can be useful to the code using the client.

Other Typealiases.html.name: Other Type Aliases
Other Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
